api package

Submodules

api.app module

This module builds the Flask app from other components.

The goal of this refactor was to create a more structured and modular application. The main application functions were separated into different independent modules and were generalized to provide higher level of reusability.

The implementation also utilizes best practices (eg. independent logging and config handler module, input validation)

api.app.bind_controller(app)[source]

Forwards the controller binding to the inner method.

api.app.bind_logger(app)[source]

Generates a logger based on the selected Config class. Then it used it as the Flask app default logger.

api.app.bind_middlewares(app)[source]

Adds the content-type checker middleware to the app.

api.app.create_app()[source]

Creates the base Flask app.

api.app.get_app()[source]

Returns the created Flask app object.

api.controllers module

The controller module contains the access points for the car-pooling API. I didn’t change the API structure described in the README.md, but generalized the common commands and implemented proper exception handling.

api.controllers.bind_controllers(app)[source]

This function is called by the app module to define the API endpoints. It returns the modified Flask app object.

By creating the data transfer objects the automated data type and value validation of the parameters is executed (with cerberus).

Flows different from the optimal execution are forwarded to the controller by raising specific Exceptions. The catching of them are separated by the HTTP status code to return.

The additional 500 status code branch never should be called normally. If this status code still appear, the logs can provide further info about the bug.

api.decorators module

Custom decorator to ensure the journeys is the waiting list is checked if the global car capacity is changed.

The waiting list can be check before or after the decorated funcion.

api.decorators.run_waiting_list_after(func)[source]
api.decorators.run_waiting_list_before(func)[source]

api.middlewares module

Content-type validating middleware. For each endpoint it checks the content-type of the request and returns 400 if it is not as registered in the __content_type_map.

class api.middlewares.ContentTypeMiddleware(app)[source]

Bases: object

Logger = None

api.services module

The service handlers execute the logic to provide result for the controller. For this it uses the domain object properties and methods.

The Car and Journey functons are separated to give the possibility to run the in separate services.

class api.services.CarHandler[source]

api.validator module

Data validator module to validate the parameters in the data transfer objects.

api.validator.validate(data_object)[source]

Receives a DTO and matches its properties with the validation schema.
